verses.text: Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in judgment.

similars.text: Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the king's son.
And a mighty king shall stand up, that shall rule with great dominion, and do according to his will.
Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.
It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.
And also the Lord shall have power over his saints, and shall reign in their midst, and shall come down in judgment upon Idumea, or the world.
Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and a King shall reign and prosper, and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth.
Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.
By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

And the king shall do according to his will; and he shall exalt himself, and magnify himself above every god, and shall speak marvellous things against the God of gods, and shall prosper till the indignation be accomplished: for that that is determined shall be done.
For the Lord shall be in their midst, and his glory shall be upon them, and he will be their king and their lawgiver.

Blessed be the Lord thy God, which delighted in thee to set thee on his throne, to be king for the Lord thy God: because thy God loved Israel, to establish them for ever, therefore made he thee king over them, to do judgment and justice.
And in mercy shall the throne be established: and he shall sit upon it in truth in the tabernacle of David, judging, and seeking judgment, and hasting righteousness.
He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
Let no man think he is ruler; but let God rule him that judgeth, according to the counsel of his own will, or, in other words, him that counseleth or sitteth upon the judgment seat.
Now therefore behold the king whom ye have chosen, and whom ye have desired! and, behold, the Lord hath set a king over you.
Clouds and darkness are round about him: righteousness and judgment are the habitation of his throne.

Therefore I will be your king the remainder of my days; nevertheless, let us appoint judges, to judge this people according to our law; and we will newly arrange the affairs of this people, for we will appoint wise men to be judges, that will judge this people according to the commandments of God.
And David my servant shall be king over them; and they all shall have one shepherd: they shall also walk in my judgments, and observe my statutes, and do them.
The king's strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish equity, thou executest judgment and righteousness in Jacob.
Blessed be the Lord thy God, which delighted in thee, to set thee on the throne of Israel: because the Lord loved Israel for ever, therefore made he thee king, to do judgment and justice.
I will be thy king: where is any other that may save thee in all thy cities? and thy judges of whom thou saidst, Give me a king and princes?
Which in his times he shall shew, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;
The Lord shall reign for ever and ever.
So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.
But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
Thou shalt be over my house, and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than thou.
But unto the Son he saith, Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of thy kingdom.
And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth, and shalt be king over Israel.
Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
And then shall the righteous shine forth in the kingdom of God.
A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
And said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.
Where the word of a king is, there is power: and who may say unto him, What doest thou?
And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.
Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:
Then ye shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.
Say among the heathen that the Lord reigneth: the world also shall be established that it shall not be moved: he shall judge the people righteously.
For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David.
And the king of the south shall be strong, and one of his princes; and he shall be strong above him, and have dominion; his dominion shall be a great dominion.
Moreover I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he be constant to do my commandments and my judgments, as at this day.
Saying, Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.
The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
Righteous art thou, O Lord, and upright are thy judgments.
For the Lord will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.
Many seek the ruler's favour; but every man's judgment cometh from the Lord.
But the Lord shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.
And thou, my lord, O king, the eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and a King shall reign and prosper, and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth.
And a mighty king shall stand up, that shall rule with great dominion, and do according to his will.
By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
And in mercy shall the throne be established: and he shall sit upon it in truth in the tabernacle of David, judging, and seeking judgment, and hasting righteousness.
And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

verses.text: And a man shall be as an hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place, as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.

similars.text: And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the daytime from the heat, and for a place of refuge, and a covert from storm and from rain.

verses.text: And the eyes of them that see shall not be dim, and the ears of them that hear shall hearken.

similars.text: But blessed are your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.
Saying, Go unto this people, and say, Hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.
And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity and out of darkness.
They are of the world: therefore speak they of the world, and the world heareth them.
The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.
The nations shall see and be confounded at all their might: they shall lay their hand upon their mouth, their ears shall be deaf.
Yet the Lord hath not given you an heart to perceive, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day.
The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.
In my name they shall open the eyes of the blind, and unstop the ears of the deaf;
Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
Bring forth the blind people that have eyes, and the deaf that have ears.
(According as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.
Hear now this, O foolish people, and without understanding; which have eyes, and see not; which have ears, and hear not:
He who hath faith to hear shall hear.
So that thou shalt be mad for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.
Who among you will give ear to this? who will hearken and hear for the time to come?
Wo unto the blind that will not see; for they shall perish also.
Hearken, O ye people, and open your hearts and give ear from afar; and listen, you that call yourselves the people of the Lord, and hear the word of the Lord and his will concerning you.
That thine eyes may be open unto the supplication of thy servant, and unto the supplication of thy people Israel, to hearken unto them in all that they call for unto thee.
And if my people will hearken unto my voice, and unto the voice of my servants whom I have appointed to lead my people, behold, verily I say unto you, they shall not be moved out of their place.
Lord, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:
The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the Lord hath made even both of them.
Then shall their watchmen lift up their voice, and with the voice together shall they sing; for they shall see eye to eye.

And the arm of the Lord shall be revealed; and the day cometh that they who will not hear the voice of the Lord, neither the voice of his servants, neither give heed to the words of the prophets and apostles, shall be cut off from among the people;

Hearken, O ye people of my church, saith the voice of him who dwells on high, and whose eyes are upon all men; yea, verily I say: Hearken ye people from afar; and ye that are upon the islands of the sea, listen together.
Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
But blessed are your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.
He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
Hear, ye deaf; and look, ye blind, that ye may see.
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?
The eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.
And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity and out of darkness.
But as it is written, To whom he was not spoken of, they shall see: and they that have not heard shall understand.

verses.text: The heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly.

similars.text: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

verses.text: The vile person shall be no more called liberal, nor the churl said to be bountiful.

For the vile person will speak villany, and his heart will work iniquity, to practise hypocrisy, and to utter error against the Lord, to make empty the soul of the hungry, and he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

similars.text: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
For assuredly as the Lord liveth they shall see that the terrible one is brought to naught, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off;
And shall begin to smite his fellow-servants, and to eat and drink with the drunken,

verses.text: The instruments also of the churl are evil: he deviseth wicked devices to destroy the poor with lying words, even when the needy speaketh right.

similars.text: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

verses.text: But the liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand.
Rise up, ye women that are at ease; hear my voice, ye careless daughters; give ear unto my speech.

similars.text: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.

verses.text: Many days and years shall ye be troubled, ye careless women: for the vintage shall fail, the gathering shall not come.
Tremble, ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye careless ones: strip you, and make you bare, and gird sackcloth upon your loins.
They shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
Upon the land of my people shall come up thorns and briers; yea, upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:

similars.text: And all nations shall call you blessed, for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the Lord of Hosts.
And all nations shall call you blessed: for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the Lord of hosts.
And the fame of this house shall spread to foreign lands; and this is the beginning of the blessing which shall be poured out upon the heads of my people. Even so. Amen.
And I will shake all nations, and the desire of all nations shall come: and I will fill this house with glory, saith the Lord of hosts.
But, behold, I, the Lord, will hasten the city in its time, and will crown the faithful with joy and with rejoicing.
Let the hearts of your brethren rejoice, and let the hearts of all my people rejoice, who have, with their might, built this house to my name.
Therefore, come up hither unto the land of my people, even Zion.

verses.text: Because the palaces shall be forsaken; the multitude of the city shall be left; the forts and towers shall be for dens for ever, a joy of wild asses, a pasture of flocks;
Until the spirit be poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness be a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be counted for a forest.

similars.text: Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field.
And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body: and they shall be as when a standardbearer fainteth.
And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body; and they shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth.
Let the field be joyful, and all that is therein: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice
For ye shall go out with joy, and be led forth with peace: the mountains and the hills shall break forth before you into singing, and all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.

verses.text: Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field.

similars.text: Until the spirit be poured upon us from on high, and the wilderness be a fruitful field, and the fruitful field be counted for a forest.
But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
Wherefore ye shall do my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do them; and ye shall dwell in the land in safety.

verses.text: And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance for ever.

similars.text: The righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
But learn that he who doeth the works of righteousness shall receive his reward, even peace in this world, and eternal life in the world to come.
For kings, and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and honesty.
But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

verses.text: And my people shall dwell in a peaceable habitation, and in sure dwellings, and in quiet resting places;

similars.text: I have surely built thee an house to dwell in, a settled place for thee to abide in for ever.
And let them make me a sanctuary; that I may dwell among them.
For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.
And men shall dwell in it, and there shall be no more utter destruction; but Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited.
And inasmuch as my people build a house unto me in the name of the Lord, and do not suffer any unclean thing to come into it, that it be not defiled, my glory shall rest upon it;
But I have built an house of habitation for thee, and a place for thy dwelling for ever.

This house shall be a healthful habitation if it be built unto my name, and if the governor which shall be appointed unto it shall not suffer any pollution to come upon it. It shall be holy, or the Lord your God will not dwell therein.
And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.
But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.

verses.text: When it shall hail, coming down on the forest; and the city shall be low in a low place.
Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth thither the feet of the ox and the ass.
